Thou shalt not raise<S>5375</S> a false<S>7723</S> report<S>8088</S>: put<S>7896</S> not thine hand<S>3027</S> with the wicked<S>7563</S> to be an unrighteous<S>2555</S> witness<S>5707</S>. <sup>raise: or, receive</sup>
Thou shalt not follow<S>310</S> a multitude<S>7227</S> to do evil<S>7451</S>; neither shalt thou speak<S>6030</S> in a cause<S>7379</S> to decline<S>5186</S> after<S>310</S> many<S>7227</S> to wrest<S>5186</S> judgment: <sup>speak: Heb. answer</sup>
Neither shalt thou countenance<S>1921</S> a poor<S>1800</S> man in his cause<S>7379</S>.
If thou meet<S>6293</S> thine enemy's<S>341</S> ox<S>7794</S> or his ass<S>2543</S> going astray<S>8582</S>, thou shalt surely<S>7725</S> bring it back<S>7725</S> to him again<S>7725</S>.
If thou see<S>7200</S> the ass<S>2543</S> of him that hateth<S>8130</S> thee lying<S>7257</S> under his burden<S>4853</S>, and wouldest forbear<S>2308</S> to help<S>5800</S> him, thou shalt surely<S>5800</S> help<S>5800</S> with him. <sup>and: or, wilt thou cease to help him? or, and wouldest cease to leave thy business for him: thou shalt surely leave it to join with him</sup>
Thou shalt not wrest<S>5186</S> the judgment<S>4941</S> of thy poor<S>34</S> in his cause<S>7379</S>.
Keep thee far<S>7368</S> from a false<S>8267</S> matter<S>1697</S>; and the innocent<S>5355</S> and righteous<S>6662</S> slay<S>2026</S> thou not: for I will not justify<S>6663</S> the wicked<S>7563</S>.
And thou shalt take<S>3947</S> no gift<S>7810</S>: for the gift<S>7810</S> blindeth<S>5786</S> the wise<S>6493</S>, and perverteth<S>5557</S> the words<S>1697</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S>. <sup>the wise: Heb. the seeing</sup>
Also thou shalt not oppress<S>3905</S> a stranger<S>1616</S>: for ye know<S>3045</S> the heart<S>5315</S> of a stranger<S>1616</S>, seeing<S>3588</S> ye were strangers<S>1616</S> in the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>. <sup>heart: Heb. soul</sup>
And six<S>8337</S> years<S>8141</S> thou shalt sow<S>2232</S> thy land<S>776</S>, and shalt gather<S>622</S> in the fruits<S>8393</S> thereof:
But the seventh<S>7637</S> year thou shalt let it rest<S>8058</S> and lie<S>5203</S> still; that the poor<S>34</S> of thy people<S>5971</S> may eat<S>398</S>: and what they leave<S>3499</S> the beasts<S>2416</S> of the field<S>7704</S> shall eat<S>398</S>. In like manner thou shalt deal<S>6213</S> with thy vineyard<S>3754</S>, and with thy oliveyard<S>2132</S>. <sup>oliveyard: or, olive trees</sup>
Six<S>8337</S> days<S>3117</S> thou shalt do<S>6213</S> thy work<S>4639</S>, and on the seventh<S>7637</S> day<S>3117</S> thou shalt rest<S>7673</S>: that thine ox<S>7794</S> and thine ass<S>2543</S> may rest<S>5117</S>, and the son<S>1121</S> of thy handmaid<S>519</S>, and the stranger<S>1616</S>, may be refreshed<S>5314</S>.
And in all things that I have said<S>559</S> unto you be circumspect<S>8104</S>: and make no mention<S>2142</S> of the name<S>8034</S> of other<S>312</S> gods<S>430</S>, neither let it be heard<S>8085</S> out<S>5921</S> of thy mouth<S>6310</S>.
Three<S>7969</S> times<S>7272</S> thou shalt keep a feast<S>2287</S> unto me in the year<S>8141</S>.
Thou shalt keep<S>8104</S> the feast<S>2282</S> of unleavened bread<S>4682</S>: (thou shalt eat<S>398</S> unleavened bread<S>4682</S> seven<S>7651</S> days<S>3117</S>, as I commanded<S>6680</S> thee, in the time appointed<S>4150</S> of the month<S>2320</S> Abib<S>24</S>; for in it thou camest out<S>3318</S> from Egypt<S>4714</S>: and none shall appear<S>7200</S> before<S>6440</S> me empty<S>7387</S>:)
And the feast<S>2282</S> of harvest<S>7105</S>, the firstfruits<S>1061</S> of thy labours<S>4639</S>, which thou hast sown<S>2232</S> in the field<S>7704</S>: and the feast<S>2282</S> of ingathering<S>614</S>, which is in the end<S>3318</S> of the year<S>8141</S>, when thou hast gathered<S>622</S> in thy labours<S>4639</S> out of the field<S>7704</S>.
Three<S>7969</S> times<S>6471</S> in the year<S>8141</S> all thy males<S>2138</S> shall appear<S>7200</S> before<S>6440</S> the Lord<S>113</S> GOD<S>3068</S>.
Thou shalt not offer<S>2076</S> the blood<S>1818</S> of my sacrifice<S>2077</S> with leavened bread<S>2557</S>; neither shall the fat<S>2459</S> of my sacrifice<S>2282</S> remain<S>3885</S> until the morning<S>1242</S>. <sup>sacrifice: or, feast</sup>
The first<S>7225</S> of the firstfruits<S>1061</S> of thy land<S>127</S> thou shalt bring<S>935</S> into the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>. Thou shalt not seethe<S>1310</S> a kid<S>1423</S> in his mother's<S>517</S> milk<S>2461</S>.
Behold, I send<S>7971</S> an Angel<S>4397</S> before<S>6440</S> thee, to keep<S>8104</S> thee in the way<S>1870</S>, and to bring<S>935</S> thee into the place<S>4725</S> which I have prepared<S>3559</S>.
Beware<S>8104</S> of<S>6440</S> him, and obey<S>8085</S> his voice<S>6963</S>, provoke<S>4843</S> him not; for he will not pardon<S>5375</S> your transgressions<S>6588</S>: for my name<S>8034</S> is in him<S>7130</S>.
But if thou shalt indeed<S>8085</S> obey<S>8085</S> his voice<S>6963</S>, and do<S>6213</S> all that I speak<S>1696</S>; then I will be an enemy<S>340</S> unto thine enemies<S>341</S>, and an adversary<S>6887</S> unto thine adversaries<S>6696</S>. <sup>an adversary: or, I will afflict them that afflict thee</sup>
For mine Angel<S>4397</S> shall go<S>3212</S> before<S>6440</S> thee, and bring<S>935</S> thee in unto the Amorites<S>567</S>, and the Hittites<S>2850</S>, and the Perizzites<S>6522</S>, and the Canaanites<S>3669</S>, the Hivites<S>2340</S>, and the Jebusites<S>2983</S>: and I will cut them off<S>3582</S>.
Thou shalt not bow down<S>7812</S> to their gods<S>430</S>, nor serve<S>5647</S> them, nor do<S>6213</S> after their works<S>4639</S>: but thou shalt utterly<S>2040</S> overthrow<S>2040</S> them, and quite<S>7665</S> break down<S>7665</S> their images<S>4676</S>.
And ye shall serve<S>5647</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> your God<S>430</S>, and he shall bless<S>1288</S> thy bread<S>3899</S>, and thy water<S>4325</S>; and I will take<S>5493</S> sickness<S>4245</S> away<S>5493</S> from the midst<S>7130</S> of thee.
There shall nothing cast their young<S>7921</S>, nor be barren<S>6135</S>, in thy land<S>776</S>: the number<S>4557</S> of thy days<S>3117</S> I will fulfil<S>4390</S>.
I will send<S>7971</S> my fear<S>367</S> before<S>6440</S> thee, and will destroy<S>2000</S> all the people<S>5971</S> to whom thou shalt come<S>935</S>, and I will make<S>5414</S> all thine enemies<S>341</S> turn their backs<S>6203</S> unto thee. <sup>backs: Heb. neck</sup>
And I will send<S>7971</S> hornets<S>6880</S> before<S>6440</S> thee, which shall drive out<S>1644</S> the Hivite<S>2340</S>, the Canaanite<S>3669</S>, and the Hittite<S>2850</S>, from before<S>6440</S> thee.
I will not drive them out<S>1644</S> from before<S>6440</S> thee in one<S>259</S> year<S>8141</S>; lest the land<S>776</S> become desolate<S>8077</S>, and the beast<S>2416</S> of the field<S>7704</S> multiply<S>7227</S> against thee.
By little<S>4592</S> and little<S>4592</S> I will drive them out<S>1644</S> from before<S>6440</S> thee, until thou be increased<S>6509</S>, and inherit<S>5157</S> the land<S>776</S>.
And I will set<S>7896</S> thy bounds<S>1366</S> from the Red<S>5488</S> sea<S>3220</S> even unto the sea<S>3220</S> of the Philistines<S>6430</S>, and from the desert<S>4057</S> unto the river<S>5104</S>: for I will deliver<S>5414</S> the inhabitants<S>3427</S> of the land<S>776</S> into your hand<S>3027</S>; and thou shalt drive them out<S>1644</S> before<S>6440</S> thee.
Thou shalt make<S>3772</S> no covenant<S>1285</S> with them, nor with their gods<S>430</S>.
They shall not dwell<S>3427</S> in thy land<S>776</S>, lest they make thee sin<S>2398</S> against me: for if thou serve<S>5647</S> their gods<S>430</S>, it will surely be a snare<S>4170</S> unto thee.
